Reason: The 'table_count_warn_threshold' configuration does not directly involve any performance-related operations that are time-extensive or memory-extensive within its related code. It is primarily used for setting a threshold for the number of tables in the cluster and triggering a warning message when the threshold is exceeded. While it may have an impact on system performance indirectly by preventing performance degradation due to a large number of tables, it does not directly cause notable performance variations at the system level. Therefore, it is classified as not performance-sensitive.
